title: Green
subtle: Concept (nonfiction), 24 words, Level aa (Grade K), Lexile BR50L
description: The forest is a beautiful and fascinating place for students to explore. In Green, students will become familiar with the color word green through a story about green plants and animals that live in a forest. Detailed photographs and repetitive text support early emergent readers. In addition to working on decoding skills, students will have the opportunity to compare and contrast as well as to ask and answer questions to better understand the text.
meta: bird, forest, frog, grass, insect, leaf, lizard, moss, snake
Ask and answer questions to better understand text
Compare and Contrast : Compare and contrast ideas from a text
Initial and Final Sounds : Discriminate initial consonant /g/ sound
Consonants : Identify initial and final consonant Gg
Periods : Identify and use periods correctly to end sentences
Alphabetical Order : Place words in alphabetical order
